alert.note: Alert for Bonner; Boundary; Kootenai (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 03 at 9:56PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Unseasonably warm temperatures, snowmelt and additional rainfall to continue rises on many rivers and creeks in the region... Very warm temperatures will continue the snow melt and runoff into area rivers and streams. River rises and increased flows will continue through the week. In addition, any thunderstorms that develop through Thursday will be capable of producing heavy rain which may further result in river rises. Thunderstorms may also produce localized debris flows in steep terrain, especially near burn scars. Urban areas as well as locations with poor drainage will also be susceptible to flooding. Late Thursday and through Friday, an area of moderate to heavy rain has the potential to bring more rises to creeks and rivers. Several rivers are forecast to reach bankfull this week or next weekend, including the Moyie and Spokane Rivers. The Kettle River and Coeur d`Alene River are also expected to reach their flood stage this week.
